physical_appearance:This photograph shows the Willemskerk church in Batavia (Jakarta) in Indonesia. The church has a circular center
 with a dome top
 and a pediment on the right. The neoclassical architecture of the building features large
 tall columns. The church sits on a bricked platform
 with steps leading up to the front. In front of the church
 there are a few cows grazing on the grass. The edges of the photograph are rounded. The title is written at the bottom
 below the photograph.

metadata.title_text: Photograph album of views and portraits in the Punjab, Cashmere, Ceylon, Burma, Penang, Singapore, and Java Wilhelm's Kirk, Koning's Plein, Batavia, Java
metadata.materials_name: albumen (egg white protein) albumen paper paper (fiber product)
metadata.physical_appearance: This photograph shows the Willemskerk church in Batavia (Jakarta) in Indonesia. The church has a circular center, with a dome top, and a pediment on the right. The neoclassical architecture of the building features large, tall columns. The church sits on a bricked platform, with steps leading up to the front. In front of the church, there are a few cows grazing on the grass. The edges of the photograph are rounded. The title is written at the bottom, below the photograph.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Photographs Thomson, J. (John), 1837-1921 Jakarta (Indonesia) Colonization Protestant churches Protestantism Neoclassical (Architecture)
